4.2. Network¶

class aleph.network.network.Network(process, addresses, public_key_list, logger, keep_connection=True)¶

Class that takes care of handling network connections with other processes.

Parameters

  • process (Process) – process who uses this network to communicate with others

  • addresses (list) – list of addresses of all committee members, ordered by their process_id. Each address is a pair (IP, port)

  • public_key_list (list) – the list of public keys of all committee members

  • logger (Logger) – where to write all the log messages

  • keep_connection (bool) – Don’t close network connection after every sync

async listener(peer_id)¶

Listen indefinitely for incoming syncs from process peer_id. This version is a counterpart for sync, follows the same 3-exchange protocol.

async start_server(server_started)¶

Start a server that waits for incoming connections and activates corresponding listen_channels :param asyncio.Event server_started: main Event used to synchronize initialization of the whole process.run. This method sets it if successful.

async sync(peer_id)¶

Sync with process peer_id. This version uses 3-exchange “pullpush” protocol: send heights, receive heights, units and requests, send units and requests. If we sent some requests there is a 4th exchange where we once again get units. This should only happen due to forks.
